ul.li: The content of bundled resources SHALL always be present except in the special case of a transaction response.
Conceptually, a bundle is a list of resources with named links. Since a Bundle is itself a Resource it has the common metadata, including profile assertions and tags.
Bundle has a 'base' element, which is used to resolve relative references present in the bundled resources.
Applications reading a bundle should always look for a resource by its identity (after converting relative URLs to absolute URL) in the bundle first before trying to access it by its URL.
